config.question: Dr. Martin Luther King, Jr., gave his “I Have a Dream” speech during the __________.

answer_3.response: Despite pleas from the government to stop demonstrations and protests, civil rights leaders kept pressure on the administration. On August 28, more than 200,000 marchers gathered in a March on Washington for a day-long rally in front of the Lincoln Memorial. The climax was Martin Luther King, Jr.’s eloquent description of his dream for America.
